channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: World Prematurity Day
item.description:
Sunday, November 17, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support World Prematurity Day.

World Prematurity Day is celebrated on 17 November each year to raise awareness of the nearly 15 million babies born premature each year. Worldwide and the nearly 1 million who lose their fight for life. Landmarks around the World are lit up purple on this Day to raise awareness of the plight of babies born premature and to honour the struggles of these babies to survive and thrive. It also raises awareness of parent groups like PIPA (Preterm Infants Parents Association).

This Light Up is organised by: PIPA (Preterm Infants Parents Association)

item.title: The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Monday, November 18, 2024

The Tropical Dome  will be lit Purple to support The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal.

For more than 70 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grants where charities apply to help vital community services and grassroots initiatives, particularly at Christmas.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

item.title: Eve of World Children's Day
item.description:
Tuesday, November 19, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptureswill be lit Teal to support Eve of World Children's Day.

Every year, World Children's Day is celebrated on 20 November, marking the date that the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child was adopted. This year is the 35th Anniversary of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. It is the most widely ratified human rights treaty in history and has helped transform children’s lives around the world.

Children’s Rights Queensland was founded in 1971 and has a rich history of promoting the rights of children and supporting communities. The organisation convenes Children's Week each year in Queensland and delivers a range of other initiatives that raise awareness of the needs, rights and achievements of children.

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Rights Queensland

item.title: Greg Normal Medal Dinner (for PGA)
item.description:
Tuesday, November 19, 2024

City Hall will be lit Green to celebrate Greg Normal Medal Dinner (for PGA).

The Greg Norman Medal, Australian golf’s most prestigious award, will be awarded at a Gala Dinner held at City Hall.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Transgender Day of Remembrance
item.description:
Wednesday, November 20, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit White, Blue and Pink to support Transgender Day of Remembrance.

Many Genders One Voice holds a Transgender Day of Remembrance ceremony every year, as part of other international events that occur during Transgender Awareness Week. This week aims to help raise the visibility of transgender, gender diverse and non-binary people, and address the issues the community faces. The final day of Transgender Awareness Week is Transgender Day of Remembrance (TDOR), an annual observance on 20 November that honours the memory of those whose lives were lost in acts of anti-transgender violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice

item.title: Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, November 21, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Month.

November 21 is World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day. Pancreatic cancer is currently responsible for the 3rd highest amount of cancer deaths, and thus is an extremely deadly cancer in Australia. On this day, we are asking venues across the globe to turn purple to honour those lost to pancreatic cancer or currently fighting, as well as raise important awareness for this disease. With only a 12.5% chance of survival beyond 5 years.

This Light Up is organised by: Pankind

item.title: Australian PGA Jarrod Lyle Yellow Day
item.description:
Friday, November 22, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Australian PGA Jarrod Lyle Yellow Day.

On the 22nd of November, the Australian PGA Championship will be helping to raise much-needed funds for Challenge, a charity devoted to supporting children and families living with cancer. Professionals and all involved in the tournament will be #DoingItForJarrod and wearing yellow in memory of Jarrod Lyle, an ambassador for Challenge and the ongoing dedication of this charity.  #DoingitforJarrod

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: National Day of the Republic of Lebanon
item.description:
Friday, November 22, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red, White and Green to support the National Day of the Republic of Lebanon.

The 22nd of November 2024 marks the 81st National Day of the Republic of Lebanon, an important day for the Lebanese community here in Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: Honorary Consul of Lebanon, Anthony Torbey
item.xCal:summary: National Day of the Republic of Lebanon
item.xCal:description:

The 22nd of November 2024 marks the 81st National Day of the Republic of Lebanon, an important day for the Lebanese community here in Brisbane.
This Light Up is organised by: Honorary Consul of Lebanon, Anthony Torbey

item.title: Australian PGA
item.description:
Saturday, November 23, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to celebrate Australian PGA.

The Australian PGA Championship is the PGA's flagship event. One of the feature events on the ISPS HANDA PGA Tour of Australasia, the time-honoured tournament will be played in Brisbane. Some of the world's best golfers are expected to converge on the event to complete for the Joe Kirkwood Cup - Australian professional golf's oldest trophy.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.xCal:description:
The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue and Green to celebrate Australian PGA.
The Australian PGA Championship is the PGA's flagship event. One of the feature events on the ISPS HANDA PGA Tour of Australasia, the time-honoured tournament will be played in Brisbane. Some of the world's best golfers are expected to converge on the event to complete for the Joe Kirkwood Cup - Australian professional golf's oldest trophy.
This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Zonta Says No to Violence Against Women
item.description:
Monday, November 25, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Orange to support Zonta Says No to Violence Against Women.

The Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc, a member of Zonta International, raises funds annually to support local projects towards a common goal – to improve the legal, educational, economic, political and health status of women. The Club is not for profit, run by volunteers and all funds raised are directed to projects, such as educational scholarships for women, support to women refuges and support services such as Brisbane Domestic Violence Service. Annually the Zonta Clubs of Brisbane conduct a campaign, under the Banner Zonta Says No to Violence against Women, to raise awareness of domestic and family violence in the community and to support women and their children when they find themselves in such a situation.

This Light Up is organised by: Zonta Club of Brisbane East Inc

item.title: The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Tuesday, November 26, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal.

For more than 70 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grants where charities apply to help vital community services and grassroots initiatives, particularly at Christmas.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

item.title: National Asbestos Awareness Week
item.description:
Wednesday, November 27, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue to support National Asbestos Awareness Week.

National Asbestos Awareness Week is held from Monday 25 November 2024 to Sunday 30 November 2024 to raise awareness about asbestos related diseases, to remember the many thousands of people who have died as a result of an asbestos related diseases and to encourage Australians to protect themselves against exposure to asbestos-containing materials, particularly when doing home renovations.

This Light Up is organised by: Asbestos Disease Support Society

item.title: Link-Up (Qld) 40th Anniversary Gala Dinner
item.description:
Thursday, November 28, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Yellow to support Link-Up (Qld) 40th Anniversary Gala Dinner.

Since 1984, Link-Up (Qld) has supported Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people affected by forced removal. Our non-profit organisation consists of an expert team of family history researchers and emotional support staff to help ‘bring our Stolen Generations survivors home’.

Link-Up (Qld)’s 40th Anniversary Gala event will be a celebration of our achievements in providing free services that have supported Stolen Generation survivors and their descendants for the past four decades. It will honour the important, ongoing work our team and partnering organisations do to reconnect Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people with their family, country and culture across Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Link-Up (Qld) Aboriginal Corporation

item.title: World Chromosone 18 Day
item.description:
Thursday, November 28, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple, Yellow, Pink, Green to support World Chromosone 18 Day.

Join Chromosome 18 families from around the World on Sunday 1 December, 2024 for World Chromosome 18 Day! This is a free, virtual event with Educational speakers, research updates, Syndrome breakouts and Self-Advocate sessions. But most of all, it is a chance to come together with our global chromosome 18 families to learn, connect, and have fun! Pre-Registration is required at www.chromosome18.org…

This Light Up is organised by: The Chromosome 18 Registry and Research Society

item.title: Lighting of the Christmas Tree
item.description:
Friday, November 29, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Lighting of the Christmas Tree.

This evening the Lord Mayor will start of the 2024 Christmas in Brisbane celebrations with the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, outside City Hall. All are invited to join in the celebrations at King George Square from 6.30pm.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Eve of Romania National Day
item.description:
Saturday, November 30, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red, Yellow and Blue to support the Eve of Romania National Day.

On 1 December the Romanian people celebrate the Great Union of Romania. This is when the country took the shape of a modern unified state and it is a symbol of great significance of unity and cultural, social and historical continuity.

This Light Up is organised by: Romanian Association Doina Queensland Inc

item.title: Lighting of the Christmas Tree
item.description:
Saturday, November 30, 2024

City Hall will be lit Red and Green to celebrate Lighting of the Christmas Tree.

This evening the Lord Mayor will start of the 2024 Christmas in Brisbane celebrations with the Lighting of the Christmas Tree, outside City Hall. All are invited to join in the celebrations at King George Square from 6.30pm.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency
